oai_dc:dc.dc:title: INSTRUMENTATION EVALUATION OF THE DEEP WATER DIRECTIONAL WAVE CLIMATE ALONG THE MEDITERRANEAN COAST OF ISREAL
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Iosilevskii, Ya. A.
Rosen, D.S.
Golik, A.
Inman, D.L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Israel
Mediterranean
deep water
wave climate
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The frequency-directional deep water wave climate along the Mediterranean coast of Israel was evaluated for the first time by computer numerical analysis using instrumental shallow water measurements. The shallow water data underlying the study were gathered within the period from 1984 through 19Q1 by two CAS C Cassette Acquisition System} wave measuring stations located off Haifa CNorthD and Ashkelon CSoutrO along the Mediterranean coast of Israel. The paper includes a brief description of the data gathering, analysis, and processing methods, and it also includes main results of the study.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 23 (1992): Proceedings of 23rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Venice, Italy, 1992.
